text: I'm Tom harlo uh Castro Farm Westminster Vermont we have 50 acres of vegetables here and we're doing about 15 to 20 acres of sweet corn our primary market for the sweet corn is uh local retail at a roadside stand that we have as far as crop rotation goes we usually start with corn or squash in a field then we move on to uh greens and then to a root crop in the third year being an organic farm we generally use a lot of compost about 20 yards per acre on everything except root crops and then we use winter Ry and vet as a cover crop on everything every year our primary cover crop here is rye which we use at um 100 lb per acre I try to substitute 10 to 20 pounds of that rye seed with vetch seed to make a total of 100 PB per acre cover crop seed uh cover crops are generally tilled in fairly early for uh some early vegetables but for corn and squash we like to wait until miday to let the Rye and the vet mature as much as possible after using a mold board plow we uh generally apply about 20 yards per acre compost and then we discar two or three times and then we're ready to plant we do soil tests here every year on every field and uh we amend our soils with compost and we use some Blended fertilizer through the Planters being an organic farmer we rely heavily on our cover crops and our compost to provide us with the nutrients that we need so that we don't have to make huge purchases of uh Blended fertilizers we make our own compost here on the farm um we have manure here that's trucked in raw manure trucked in from the local Dairy Farm best stuff we get is mixed with a lot of straw dumped in a wind row we turn it every two or three weeks with a bucket loader gives us excellent compost the way it is
